TableDefinition.Name: Consumer product application amounts
TableDefinition.Description: Distributions of consumer product application amounts represent the quantities used or applied during a single use. These distributions can be characterized for the general population or for specific subgroups based on age and/or sex.

ColumnDefinition.Description: Specifies the lower bound of the age interval (in years) of the application amount in case the distribution applies to a specific population age subgroup. Individuals belong to a subgroup when the age of the individual is equal or greater than the specified lower bound and smaller than the specified lower age of the next subgroup.
Specifies the sex associated with this application amount in case the distribution applies to a specific population sex subgroup.
Mean of the distribution. Amounts are in kg (default unit).
Type of the distribution. If not specified, the application amount is assumed to be constant.
Coefficient of variation of the distribution.
The unit for the consumer product application amount. When not specified, then a default unit of g (gram) is assumed.
